Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Lausporin-2 (natural AMPs; Leu-rich; scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)

Literature.Author: Zhao Z, Zhang K, Zhu W, Ye X, Ding L, Jiang H, Li F, Chen Z, Luo X. 2021
Literature.Title: Two new cationic alpha-helical peptides identified from the venom gland of Liocheles australasiae possess antimicrobial activity against methicillin-resistant staphylococci.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (88.89%) toscorpion 	Uy234L: 28%; S: 17%; F=I=A=P=K: 11%;  GRAVY: 1.32; M Wt: 1958.455; M formula: C97H160N20O22; mol ex coeff: 0, pI: 10.00.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 or MRSA (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC 20 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), S. capitis (MIC 2.5-5 ug/ml), S. intermedius (MIC 5 ug/ml), Gram- E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 40-80 ug/ml), P-aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC>80 ug/ml),  K-pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC > 80 ug/ml).Toxicity: human RBC, HC50 45 ug/ml.Structure:  helical in 30-70% TFE.MOA:bacteria: act on membranes via pore formation.
